DOC.detailed_description: This clinical protocol , randomize , crossover , double-blind ( patient data analyst ) hold . The study protocol register clinicalTrials.gov - NCT02398344 . Methods Individuals AVE recruit physical therapy clinic Universidade Nove de Julho - Sao Paulo , Brazil . The participant recruit select base follow eligibility criterion : Sample size Sample 20 participant ( 05 participant level motor impairment - mild , moderate , mark severe ) take . The proposed measure FSM base neurological examination sensory-motor activity upper low limb order identify selective synergistic activity pattern patient suffer stroke . This scale construct follow hypothesis restoration motor function hemiplegic patient follow defined course . It represent three-point ordinal scale apply every item : 0- perform , partially perform 1- 2 - fully realize . The total scale 100 point normal motor function , maximum score upper end 66 low 34 . The motor evaluation include measurement motion , coordination reflex activity shoulder , elbow , wrist , hand , hip , knee ankle determine score accord motor impairment level , le 50 point indicate severe motor impairment ; 85-95 moderate ; 50-84 remarkable 96-99 light ²⁷ . Analysis heart rate variability ( HRV ) : The Heart rate variability analyze four stage : 1 . Resting 01 : The heart rate ( HR ) capture mean heart rate monitor ( RS800 CX ) online data transmit computer , period 10 minute rest . Individuals instruct remain recumbent 10 minute , avoid activity without sleep , examination patient remain sit position posture 10 minute follow guideline give . 2 . In exercise : After initial 20 minute rest , patient start six-minute walk test . The FC collect heart rate monitor throughout walk test , well post exercise recovery ( 2minutes ) . In recovery patient remain sit position , instructed verbalize move evaluation . 3 . Electrical stimulation direct current ( Home ) : After walk ( 6MWT ) recovery hemodynamic parameter baseline parameter , stimulation tDCS sit position posture start , stimulation HR collect . 4 . 6 minute walk test 02 : After finish tDCS , patient perform 6MWT guideline American Thoracic Society ³⁰ , assess FC . After test give continuity HRV analysis 2 minute patient sit position , without verbalize without move , order analyze behavior autonomic nervous system . 6-minute walk test - reliable measure assess physical fitness functional mobility ³⁰ . The test quantify meter distance travel individual six minute . It perform accordance guideline establish American Thoracic Society ³⁰ . During walk test patient tell stop feel bad , always researcher side avoid possible falls test run monitor oximeter ( More Fitness MF-417® ) . 2.5.1 . Stimulation procedures transcranial direct current The transcranial electrical stimulation DC ( tDCS ) perform tag device 1 CH Tct Research tDCS Simulator model 101® mean two surface sponge electrode , ( non-metallic ) 5-7 cm2 humidify saline , 2mA current . Individuals submit four experimental condition , order distribute randomization manila envelope . 1. tDCS anode leave temporal cortex ( T3 ) cathode contralateral supraorbital region ; 2. tDCS sham leave temporal cortex ( T3 ) cathode above-orbitalcontralateral region ; 3. tDCS anode right temporal cortex ( T4 ) cathode contralateral supraorbital region ; 4. tDCS sham right temporal cortex ( T4 ) cathode contralateral supra orbital region . Protocol 1 2 : The anode electrode position left temporal cortex ( T3 ) , locate 40 % distance leave side Cz point follow international 10-20 system electroencephalogram cathode electrode region supra orbital contralateral anode . Protocol 3 4 : The anode electrode position right temporal cortex ( T4 ) cathode position leave supraorbital region . Active stimulation application time placebo 20 minute . In sham stimulation , electrode placement procedure also perform like procedure anodic tDCS , leave right temporal cortex , however , stimulator turn 30 second , patient tell feel slight initial tingling , reduce , disappear remain 20 minute application .
